articles.headline: Budget Talks Near Collapse as G.O.P. Leader Quits
articles.snippet: Representative Eric Cantor, the House majority leader, abandoned the negotiations Thursday, and Republicans said they would not give in to a push by Democrats for new revenue.
articles.abstract: Representative Eric Cantor, the House majority leader, abandoned the negotiations Thursday, and Republicans said they would not give in to a push by Democrats for new revenue.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Congressional Republicans on Thursday abandoned budget talks aimed at clearing the way for a federal debt limit increase, leaving the outcome in doubt as they vowed not to give in to a Democratic push for new tax revenues as part of any compromise.

articles.headline: Drug Makers Win Two Supreme Court Decisions
articles.snippet: One of the Supreme Court rulings limits suits from people injured by generic drugs and another strikes down a law on prescription data.
articles.abstract: One of the Supreme Court rulings limits suits from people injured by generic drugs and another strikes down a law on prescription data.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Thursday handed drug companies two significant victories, one limiting suits from people injured by generic drugs and the other striking down a law that banned some commercial uses of prescription data.

articles.headline: F.T.C. Is Said Near a Move on Google
articles.snippet: The Federal Trade Commission is reportedly preparing to issue subpoenas in a wide-ranging civil investigation into practices in Google’s search engine business.
articles.abstract: The Federal Trade Commission is reportedly preparing to issue subpoenas in a wide-ranging civil investigation into practices in Google’s search engine business.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Trade Commission is preparing to issue subpoenas to Google as part of a wide-ranging civil antitrust investigation into practices in Google’s search engine business, according to two people with knowledge of the matter.
articles.byline: By Edward Wyatt and Miguel Helft

articles.headline: Arrest Puts Spotlight on Brazen Hacking Group LulzSec
articles.snippet: Charges in Britain link Ryan Cleary, 19, to the group that has attacked the Web sites of the U.S. Senate, the Central Intelligence Agency, PBS and Sony.
articles.abstract: Charges in Britain link Ryan Cleary, 19, to the group that has attacked the Web sites of the U.S. Senate, the Central Intelligence Agency, PBS and Sony.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — As suspects go, Ryan Cleary did not look dangerous: a pale 19-year-old who looked five years younger, wearing a white skateboarding T-shirt and track pants, standing nervously in a courtroom here on Thursday.
articles.byline: By Ravi Somaiya and Steve Lohr

articles.headline: Seized Phone Offers Clues to Bin Laden’s Pakistani Links
articles.snippet: Osama bin Laden used the militant group Harakat-ul-Mujahedeen, which has links to Pakistani intelligence, as part of his support network.
articles.abstract: Osama bin Laden used the militant group Harakat-ul-Mujahedeen, which has links to Pakistani intelligence, as part of his support network.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — The cellphone of Osama bin Laden’s trusted courier, which was recovered in the raid that killed both men in Pakistan last month, contained contacts to a militant group that is a longtime asset of Pakistan’s intelligence agency, senior American officials who have been briefed on the findings say.
articles.byline: By Carlotta Gall, Pir Zubair Shah and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Used Gas Sippers, Keeping That New-Car Value
articles.snippet: High gas prices and tight supplies of many popular compact models have pushed the price of some used cars, like the Toyota Prius, close to the list price of a new one.
articles.abstract: High gas prices and tight supplies of many popular compact models have pushed the price of some used cars, like the Toyota Prius, close to the list price of a new one.
articles.lead_paragraph: Cars are not supposed to be a good investment. But Spencer Hunter, an Oregon patent lawyer, recently turned a small profit selling his 13-month-old Toyota Prius.

articles.headline: Forecasts for Growth Drop, Some Sharply
articles.snippet: Disappointing data and worries about the strength of the global economy have made economists scale down their 2011 forecasts, some by half.
articles.abstract: Disappointing data and worries about the strength of the global economy have made economists scale down their 2011 forecasts, some by half.
articles.lead_paragraph: A drumbeat of disappointing data about consumer behavior, factory sales and weak hiring in recent weeks has prompted economists to ratchet down their 2011 economic forecasts to as little as half what they expected at the beginning of the year.
